summary: A simple Akaviri themed player home located at the northern coast of Skyrim near Dawnstar.
descriptionHtml:
[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/Description_zps14414dbc.gif[/IMG]
Adds a player home(or man cave hideout) called Sea Warden Temple inside a crowned cave west of Dawnstar. It uses the Broken Oar Grotto cell as the base and from there built an Akaviri themed home using Sky Haven Temple resources. I made it as lore friendly as possible, Made it simple/streamlined as possible using consistent architecture types and not an over-the-top mishmash of different types of architecture and clutter. Simplicity in itself is beauty so to speak.

[b]Notes:[/b]
[i][color=orange]A letter found in Sky Haven Temple will point you to the right direction.[/color]

About the naming convention, not sure if it is lorewise. \"Sea\" because the first word is often associated with an element of Earth/Nirn and the fact that this is near the sea, \"Warden\" because somehow the second word is often associated with a protector, shelter, etc. and of course \"Temple\". Anyway, enough babbling.[/i]

[youtube]RWipb6XL7co[/youtube]
[color=cyan]Thanks to orb29 for his video![/color]


[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/Requirements_zps78829161.gif[/IMG]
Skyrim 1.8.151.0
7zip (to extract the archive)
http://www.7-zip.org/download.html
No SKSE required


[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/Installation_zpse0dc88b0.gif[/IMG]
Simply extract the archive to you Skyrim installation folder.
Or just use NMM for a one click easy install.


[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/Features_zpsd2b69e3f.gif[/IMG]
[b] 1. [/b] Fully navmeshed interior
[b] 2. [/b] All crafting amenities at your disposal
[b] 3. [/b] Modest amount of Mannequins and Weapon Racks
[b] 4. [/b] Modest amount of storage classified by item type
[b] 5. [/b] Lore friendly


[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/FuturePlans_zps23e69efb.gif[/IMG]
[b] 1. [/b] Bugfixes and tweaks
[b] 2. [/b] Modular construction functionality (ala Hearthfire or BYOH)
[b] 3. [/b] Quest and storyline
[b] 4. [/b] Guardians to defeat(Undead Dragonguard/Blades)
[b] 5. [/b] [s]Small dock and fast travel boat from entrance to home and vice versa[/s]
[b] 6. [/b] [s]Shrines[/s]

[color=red][b]Known Issues:[/b]
-Followers not crossing the stone bridge
-Followers not teleporting when using fast travel boat[/color]

[color=yellow]Im no scripting wizard by any means, my CK knowledge is limited and don\'t have the luxury of time so these plans might not see the light of day. But I will do my best to learn and continue on with said plans.[/color]


[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/CompatibilityIssues_zpsde834ab3.gif[/IMG]
[color=lime][b]NONE AS OF NOW[/b][/color]


[IMG]http://i1279.photobucket.com/albums/y540/mandothreesixtee/ModDescElements/Credits_zps4b965ba2.gif[/IMG]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14134] OpenBooks Resource by Blary [/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16525] Modders Resource Pack by Oaristys and Tony67 [/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25859] TES5Edit by ElminsterAU, Sharlikran and the rest of his team  [/url]

[color=orange]Feedback, comments and bug reports greatly appreciated.[/color]
author: MandoThunderspear

files.name: SeaWardenTemple_v09
files.changelogHtml:
-Added shrines to the eight(No Talos, This is a Second Era Blades temple. Talos hasn't existed in that period yet.)
-Fast travel boat(Quick way to travel to the living area to the cave entrance.)
-Ramps for those who prefer swimming
-Navmesh fixes and tweaks
